passages.text:
You wake up in a strange room, surrounding by cats. Everything inside this room looks so familiar: the chair, the lamp, the laptop, and the photos on the wall. It looks like your bedroom, but you can tell that it is not. 
[[Get Up->Where am I?]]
[[Keep Still->What happened?]]
passages.name: Introduce

passages.text:
You have no clue about where you are. You just survived another day as usual and suddenly, boom, you are here. 
But there is no time to complain, you clearly don't wanna be a "chicken" for some winners' dinner and of course, the fist thing first, is to find a way out.
You glance around and get attracted by the cats.
Yes, you are a cat lover, and also a dog lover.
You stare at the cats, trying to find some possible connections with them and figure out who they are.
A Siamese cat, a Ragdoll cat, and a Maine Coon cat.
Awww, they are just three cutie pies and what else can they be?
ALIENS?!
You are pretty depressed. 
[[Find my Phone->Where is my Phone?]]
passages.name: Where am I?

passages.text:
You decide to check your phone to see if you can get any help. You open one of your pockets but nothing is there, and you try another one, same result.
Wait, Wait a mintue...
WHERE IS MY PHONE?!
You look around.
There is a phone on the table.
You pick it up and unlock it with your passcode.
[[Check the Phone->This is not my phone]]
passages.name: Where is my Phone?

passages.text:
You are too upset to even move your fingers. Thousands of posibilities suddenly passed through your mind and they don't help you get peace at all. 
Therefore, you decide to keep still. 
You take a deep breath, trying to breath in as much air as possible. 
Clearly, it makes you feel a little bit better. You can hear the sound "Lub-dub Lub-dub" repeating regularly. 
After taking a 5 minutes break, you feel like that it's time to get up.
You notice that there is a phone on the table, which looks like yours, however, it requires a 4-digits passcode to unlock.
				[[Enter Your Birthday->This is not my phone]]
				[[Enter 0000->Why it works]]
passages.name: What happened?

passages.text:
The phone is fully charged and works fine except it has no signal.
Nevertheless, after you check the phone for a minute, you realize that this phone is not fine at all. The only thing left in your mind is -- RUN.
You gotta get out of here. Quickly, immediately, and NOW.
This is not your phone. 
Eventhough the passcode is the same and the applications, the wallpaper, the notes, and the contacts are so familiar to you, just like this room, you can feel it that this is not your room. 
You rush to the door.
[[Open the Door->Escape?]]
[[Take a Breath->Safe for now]]
passages.name: This is not my phone

passages.text:
It doesn't make sense to unlock a phone with the simplest passcode "0000".
But it works, you get access to the phone.
The phone is fully charged and works fine except it has no signal.
Nevertheless, after you check the phone for a minute, you realize that this phone is not fine at all. The only thing left in your mind is -- RUN.
You gotta get out of here. Quickly, immediately, and NOW.
This is not your phone. 
You would never use a passcode like "0000" to protect your privacy.
But this phone looks exactly like your phone. The wallpaper, the notes, the applications, the photos, and the contacts. They are so familiar to you. 
Just like this room. Eventhough everything inside looks the same, you still can feel it that this is not your room. It is not your phone.
You rush to the door.
[[Open the Door->Escape?]]
[[Take a Breath->Safe for now]]
passages.name: Why it works

passages.text:
There is no way out.
You think. 
Behind the door, there is a new room looks exactly like your room.
But you can feel it.
It is not your room.
What on earth is going on here?!
passages.name: Escape?

passages.text:
"What if there is a murderer standing behind this door and waiting for me to open the door by myself?"
You try to calm down.
"What if this door is broken and can never be open?"
You take another breath of fresh air.
No window, no other door inside this room.
You have no choice. 
Open the door seems to be better than just waiting for now.
[[Open the Door->Escape?]]
passages.name: Safe for now
